definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: 6But when the sun came up, the plants were scorched, and they withered because they had no root.
sentences.chinese: 日头出来一晒，因为没有根，就枯干了。

sentences.english: The temple on which Kratos stood, was the Sun Chariot of Helios.
sentences.chinese: 奎托斯脚下的这座神殿，就是赫利俄斯的日头战车。

sentences.english: On one steamy afternoon they were taking refuge in a cellphone service center.
sentences.chinese: 一个炎热的下午，他们跑到手机服务中心躲躲日头。

sentences.english: By the time Lot reached Zoar, the sun had risen over the land.
sentences.chinese: 罗得到了琐珥，日头已经出来了。

sentences.english: As a cow, you must go to the field with the farmer all day long.
sentences.chinese: 作为牛，你必须跟农夫下田，整天在日头下干活。

sentences.english: The fourth angel poured out his bowl on the sun, and it was allowed to scorch people with fire.
sentences.chinese: 第四位天使把碗倒在日头上，叫日头能用火烤人。

sentences.english: A city spell-bound under the aging sun.
sentences.chinese: 苍老的日头下整座城都被魔咒封锁。

sentences.english: 8 the sun to govern the day, His love endures forever.
sentences.chinese: 他造日头管白昼，因他的慈爱永远长存。

sentences.english: And when the sun was up, they were scorched; and because they had no root, they withered away.
sentences.chinese: 日头出来一晒，因为没有根，就枯干了。

sentences.english: But when the sun was up, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.
sentences.chinese: 日头出来一晒，因为没有根，就枯干了。

sentences.english: And the fourth angel poured out his vial upon the sun; and power was given unto him to scorch men with fire.
sentences.chinese: 第四位天使把碗倒在日头上，叫日头能用火烤人。

sentences.english: The witch lost her powers with the setting of the sun.
sentences.chinese: 日头落山后，神巫掉去了法力。

sentences.english: And in Malachi, He is the Son of Righteousness with healing in His wings.
sentences.chinese: 在玛拉基书，祂是公义的日头，发出医治的大能。

sentences.english: She wore a cap and a pair of sunglasses.
sentences.chinese: 她戴着一顶头巾和一副日头眼睛儿。

sentences.english: The Sun and the benefits that people receive from sunlight will be restored.
sentences.chinese: 日头与人的总称从阳光中接受的福利会被恢复。

sentences.english: His face shone like the sun, and his clothes became as white as the light.
sentences.chinese: 脸面明亮如日头，衣裳洁白如光。

definition: color of the sky/time of day, as indicated by the color of the sky/weather
inclining to the west (e.g. of the sun after noon, indicating lateness of the day)
the sun sets in the west (idiom)
the sun sets over western hills (idiom); the day approaches its end/fig. time of decline/the end of an era/Sic transit gloria mundi
to hold a lamp/to light a lamp
11 am-1 pm (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
sun/CL:個|个[ge4]/abbr. for 太陽穴|太阳穴[tai4 yang2 xue2]
